<div>

<font size = 3px font color = "black" >Mathew (Mat) Cieśla received his BA (*cum laude*) in psycholinguistics with a minor in German language and philology from New College at the University of Alabama, Tuscaloosa, USA. In 2022, he was awarded the prestigious Fulbright Grant (for independent research) by the U.S.-Polish Fulbright Commission to conduct research at Adam Mickiewicz University, Poznań. Here, he collaborated with <a href = "https://anglistyka.amu.edu.pl/en/staff-list/katarzyna-jankowiak" target = "_blank">Dr. Katarzyna Jankowiak</a> and <a href = "https://www.bcbl.eu/en/conocenos/equipo/efthymia-kapnoula" target ="_blank"> Dr. Efthymia Kapnoual</a> comparing neural responses to orthographic and image referents in early-stage second language acquisition. Currently, Mathew holds a position at Northumbria University, Newcastle-Upon-Tyne, UK as as a postgraduate researcher and demonstrator at the Department of Psychology. His Ph.D. work is supervised by <a href = "https://glennwilliams.me" target = "_blank">Dr. Glenn Williams</a> and co-supervised by <a href = "https://www.northumbria.ac.uk/about-us/our-staff/b/hazel-blythe/" target = "_blank">Dr. Hazel Blythe</a> and <a href = "https://www.abertay.ac.uk/staff-search/professor-vera-kempe/" target = "_blank">Dr. Vera Kempe</a>.

</font>
